name: Ennius
title: writer and poet of the Roman Republic
quote: Let no one weep for me, or celebrate my funeral with mourning; for I still live, as I pass to and fro through the mouths of men.
context: ; lines dictated to be engraved on his memorial. Only fragments of his works now survive

name: Sejong the Great
title: king of the Joseon Dynasty
quote: Although dealing with the Japanese and the barbarians is not something that should be taken lightly, I fear that as peace is ingrained in you, the days growing longer, all matters be done lazily and slowly, so you should always be careful and watch out every day, so you do not give in to negligence.
context: Korea would later be invaded and pillaged by the Japanese, and later, subjugated by the Manchus, who the Koreans considered 'barbarians'

name: Field Marshal Kurt Christoph Graf von Schwerin (6 May 1757)
quote: Let all brave Prussians follow me!
context: at the Battle of Prague, immediately before being struck by a cannonball

name: Gustav III
title: King of Sweden
quote: I feel sleepy, and a moment of rest would do me good.
context: 13 days after being shot in the back at a masquerade

name: John Adams
title: Founding Father and second president of the United States
context: unaware that Jefferson had died earlier that same day

name: General John Sedgwick (9 May 1864) at the Battle of Spotsylvania Court House shortly before being killed by enemy fire.
quote: They couldn't hit an elephant at this distance. [...] All right, my man; go to your place.
context: at the Battle of Spotsylvania Court House shortly before being killed by enemy fire

name: Captain Buckey O'Neill (1 July 1898)
quote: Sergeant, the Spanish bullet isn't made that will kill me.
context: one of Theodore Roosevelt's Rough Riders, just before being shot in the mouth prior to charge up Kettle Hill

name: Richard A. Loeb (28 January 1936)
quote: I think I'm going to make it.
context: after being slashed 56 times with a razor in a prison fight

name: Johnny Ace (25 December 1954)
quote: I'll show you that it won't shoot.
context: American musician, playing with a .32 caliber revolver

name: John F. Kennedy
title: president of the United States
context: replying to co-passenger Nellie Connally saying, "You certainly can't say Dallas doesn't love you, Mr. President" while travelling through Dallas in a motorcade, shortly before he was fatally shot

name: Harold Holt
title: Prime Minister of Australia
quote: I know this beach like the back of my hand.
context: ; he would subsequently disappear while swimming at Cheviot Beach, Victoria

name: Terry Kath (23 January 1978)
quote: What do you think I'm gonna do? Blow my brains out?
context: of the band Chicago, just before putting a supposedly unloaded semi-automatic 9mm pistol to his temple and pulling the trigger

name: Vic Morrow
title: American actor
quote: I've got to be crazy to do this shot. I should've asked for a double.
context: prior to being killed along with two child actors during the filming of Twilight Zone: The Movie

name: Pete Maravich
title: American basketball player
context: before dying of an undiagnosed heart defect during a pickup game

name: Brandon Vedas (12 January 2003)
quote: I told u I was hardcore [...] u are so fucking stupid
context: American computer enthusiast talking on IRC during a fatal drug overdose

name: William Donaldson
title: British satirist and playboy
context: to the caretaker of his building, who had collected pills for him on which he would later overdose

name: Hasan Bitmez
title: Turkish MP
quote: Even if you escape the torment of history, you will not be able to escape the wrath of Allah.
context: after calling on the wrath of God on the State of Israel in the Grand National Assembly of Turkey before collapsing due to a heart attack. He would die two days later

name: Charlie Kirk
title: American conservative political activist and author, founder and CEO of Turning Point USA
quote: Counting or not counting gang violence?
context: in response to being asked "Do you know how many mass shooters there have been in America in the last 10 years?" while hosting an audience at Utah Valley University, immediately before being assassinated
